162788.description:
Thanks for signing up to attend this Text Banking Event! Yang Gang does not have enough volunteers in Iowa, so we must volunteer digitally to connect with voters. Iowa is an essential state that we must outreach. Our concentration will be rural Iowa.

Below is what we plan to do:
* Immediately send Voter Identification texts to thousands of potential voters
* Get trained to text if you haven’t already gone through the training process. 
* If you can, follow this step-by-step guide to get trained prior to the event: http://bit.ly/35Qhi9Q 

Note:
Sorry, this space is NOT "child" friendly. No one will be admitted under the age of 17! No exceptions.

This is a private business that is offering office space for Yang Gang text banking. The max capacity is 12 people at a time. You do not have to stay for the full hours of this event, but the minimum hours of volunteering that's expected is 2.

Feel free to bring a potluck of food and drinks to share. There are also local restaurants on the ground floor of this building.
162788.title: Los Angeles Text Banking Party: For Iowa

167059.description:
Door to Door Canvassing (includes training for first-timers)

Face-to-face conversations are an effective way to build awareness and support for Andrew Yang’s campaign. Every door-to-door canvassing event is an opportunity for your volunteering time to have a significant, positive impact for the campaign.

Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the official starting time so you will be ready to receive training, guidelines, and materials before we begin walking the neighborhood.

Dress business casual and/or wear your Yang clothes, especially your MATH hat. 

Bring: 
(1) a water bottle and snacks you can carry in your pocket 
(2) a clipboard with a few sheets of blank paper, if you have one 
(3) a mobile "smart" device such as a smartphone or a tablet to run the canvassing app 
(4) a MATH hat if you have one
167059.title: Fort Collins Door-To-Door Canvassing
167059.summary: Spread Andrew Yang's vision through conversations

6 pm - 8 pm every Thursday

At this event we will:
1) Sign you up for text banking if you haven't signed up before
2) Send out texts for Andrew while building our community
3) Discuss other ways to spread the word about Andrew

If you have any questions please let us know. 
Hope to see you there!
167240.title: Weekly Minneapolis Text Banking & Yang Gang Meet-Up

175666.description:
This event has been revised for signature collection only:

YANG WON’T WIN IF HE’S NOT ON THE BALLOT!

Drop by to sign the petition, or help gather signatures.  We’ll be meeting up at first, but then will be on the move.   Please reach out to the event lead to get location updates!

To sign/witness the petition in person, you must be REGISTERED: 
1) as a Democrat Voter (look yourself up at https://voterlookup.elections.ny.gov/) 
2) to vote in District 13 (check results from the lookup)
Voter Registration Lookup: https://voterlookup.elections.ny.gov/ or google “NY Voter Lookup”
Geographic Map of District 13
https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/NY/13
PLEASE REVIEW:
https://sites.google.com/yang2020.com/nypetition

January 17:  We'll start indoors to get ready for signature collecting, then go to the Schomburg Center at W. 135 St. and Lenox Ave.
175666.title: NY, NY - Staff-Led Yang Gang Weekly Signature Collecting in NY-13

179744.title: Hempstead, NY - Signature Gathering
179744.description:
Mon 1/27/20	8:00am - 8:00pm EST

Help Andrew Yang and our NY CD-4 delegates get on the ballot! We've been given a tall order - to collect a whole bunch of signatures (5000 for our Presidential candidate, 500 for each delegate!) before early February. Let's crush these goals and keep this campaign rolling. CD-2 and -3 Yangsters may also have a good amount of luck here, so please come out to support us!

This is the first day of classes in the Spring Semester at Hofstra, which has lots of local students, so I'm excited for the opportunity to collect lots of signatures.

Feel free to swing by at any time during the 8AM - 8PM window, but would really appreciate if you could spend at least ~2-3 hours helping out the campaign. We'll be busy collecting signatures for the most part, but I'm planning to have down time so we can bake a Yang Gang Hang into this day! :) Let's meet some local Yang Gang members, Yang some Long Islanders (super important, because we need more than 15% of votes for a Congressional District to secure DNC delegates), and help Make America Think Harder!

180501.description:
With only a handful of weeks remaining before the Caucus, join the Yang Gang as we continue to build our wave of momentum before it crashes down on Feb. 3 the business as usual system stacked against working class Iowans.

We have the grassroots energy to win this election, but we can’t let up if we want to rewrite the rules of the 21st century and put Andrew Yang in the White House. So let’s knock on every door and make every phone call we can to show our friends and neighbors how a Humanity First national would benefit them.

Every day our passionate supporters reach out to those in their communities to share Andrew’s plans to create opportunity for every American and ensure our children the future they deserve.  

If you’ve never volunteered before, no worries! Our friendly staff will help catch you up to speed. In fact, many of Andrew Yang’s most ardent volunteers are first time Caucus goers. What matters most is that you realize your own power. In every door knock and every phone call, our movement is one step closer to achieving Andrew’s vision: an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality, for every person. 

Please join us and be a part of that effort. Nothing short of the future of our nation is at stake.

Note: If you do, thank you! Please bring a fully charged cell phone. We've got everything else you will need, including Andrew Yang merchandise for volunteers that help multiple times!
180501.title: Weekend Phone Bank: Dubuque
180501.summary: Calling all Yang Gang for Call Time

We have the grassroots energy to win this election, but we can’t let up if we want to rewrite the rules of the 21st century and put Andrew Yang in the White House. So let’s knock on every door and make every phone call we can to show our friends and neighbors how a Humanity First national would benefit them.

Every day our passionate supporters reach out to those in their communities to share Andrew’s plans to create opportunity for every American and ensure our children the future they deserve.

If you’ve never volunteered before, no worries! Our friendly staff will help catch you up to speed. In fact, many of Andrew Yang’s most ardent volunteers are first time Caucus goers. What matters most is that you realize your own power. In every door knock and every phone call, our movement is one step closer to achieving Andrew’s vision: an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality, for every person.

Please join us and be a part of that effort. Nothing short of the future of our nation is at stake.

Note: If you do, thank you! Please bring a fully charged cell phone. We've got everything else you will need, including Andrew Yang merchandise for volunteers that help multiple times!

180623.description:
What up, Yang Gang! 
 
Join us to knock on doors for Andrew Yang. Speaking to voters face-to-face is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming caucus. No experience required and introverts welcome! You will be trained. 
 
We will have everything teed up for you and ready to go. With the scripts and drop down menus on your screen, it couldn't be easier. You will need your phone, of course. 
 
Every conversation with a voter gets us that much closer to winning Iowa for Andrew! 

PS Bring a friend!

PPS If you can't canvass, we will do mini phone banks as well.
180623.title: Neighborhood Knocking: Burlington
180623.summary: Knocking doors till the caucus comes home

180791.description:
My goal is to bring together the Yang Gang of Upstate New York for lunch at the Moon and River Cafe.  We'll talk about ways we can help Andrew Yang win the election, like text banking or canvassing.  Below is what we plan on covering at the meeting:

1.  Introductions and what drew you to the Yang 2020 campaign.
2.  How we can get more involved in canvassing, texting, signature gathering, etc.

180874.description:
Door to Door Canvassing (includes training for first-timers)

Face-to-face conversations are an effective way to build awareness and support for Andrew Yang’s campaign. Every door-to-door canvassing event is an opportunity for your volunteering time to have a significant, positive impact for the campaign.

Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the official starting time so you will be ready to receive training, guidelines, and materials before we begin walking the neighborhood.

Dress business casual and/or wear your Yang clothes, especially your MATH hat. 

Bring: 
(1) a water bottle and snacks you can carry in your pocket 
(2) a clipboard with a few sheets of blank paper, if you have one 
(3) a mobile "smart" device such as a smartphone or a tablet to run the canvassing app , MiniVAN (Please try and load it into your device before you arrive)
(4) a MATH hat if you have one
180874.title: Fairfield, CT Canvassing
180874.summary: Spread Andrew Yang's vision through conversations

181096.description:
Speaking to voters face-to-face in early states is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming election right now. Let's bring our MA Yang Gang energy to our northern Yangsters and help Andrew Yang win the New Hampshire February 11 primary!

You MUST complete this Google Survey as part of this sign-up in order to be matched with other supporters and matching shift preferences: https://bit.ly/2q421Sw (Note: Mobilize shows you the start and end times of the first and last available shift)

The Massachusetts Yang Gang Operations Team will help to match drivers to riders toward our sister city, Manchester, NH. Canvassing is more fun with friends after all!

We'll carpool to New Hampshire leaving at 9 am, canvass until 4 pm, and then have a celebratory Yang Hang with volunteers from around the region, local Yang Gang and campaign staff members. To return, we'll depart New Hampshire around 7-8 pm. Return to MA by 8:00-9:00 pm.

Bring a friend, download the app "MiniVAN", on your smartphone and meet us for a fun-filled day in the neighborhood. Here’s a guide with more explanation: http://bit.ly/y2020canvass (edited)

Not sure which region you belong in? Check out the "Carpool Map for MA" tab on this spreadsheet: http://bit.ly/YGNECarpool
181096.title: Central MA to Manchester NH - Carpool, Canvass, and Yang Hang

181905.description:
All Yang Gang are invited to join the 2020 Chinese New Year Cultural Fair-Year of the Rat by one of the event organizers. We are going to set up a tabling to promote Andrew Yang. This is a great opportunity to reach out more people from various backgrounds,have different perspectives, and  want to support Andrew Yang or learn more about his policies at the event! 

Questions? Contact Amy Liu: 503-317-3522 

Where: Oregon Convention Center 
777 NE Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. 
Portland OR 97232  

When: Saturday, January 25, 2020 (10am - 5pm PST)

Please mark the day on your calendar and join the event. I just sent the mobilized event to Yang2020. I will post it on facebook  with more details after it is approved . 

The following email is from one of the event organizers:
"Hi Amy :

Every year our newspaper organized the 2020 Chinese New Year Cultural Fair which attract a few thousand audiences to the fair.

Since you are so involved to promote Andrew Yang, maybe this is a chance that you can consider to reach out to more people by getting a vendor booth at the event.

I attached a booth application form just in case.  Thank you for your attention.
Rosaline Hui 
Portland Chinese Times"
181905.title: Portland, OR- Tabling Event at Chinese New Year Cultural Fair

183303.description:
It is a TOP CAMPAIGN PRIORITY to call voters in the Early States (Iowa + New Hampshire)!

SFYG is hosting Pizza + Phonebank + Prizes parties every Saturday from 12-4pm.

Drop in at any time between Noon-4pm, whether it's 30 min, an hour, two hours, however much time you can dedicate to get Yang elected!

Just bring your own laptop, earbuds/headphones, and a positive attitude :) 

---

January schedule:

- Sat 1/4 @ 425 Market#900, Host: Eric 


- Sat 1/11 @ 680 Folsom, Host: Elaine


- Sat 1/18 @ 601 Townsend, Host: Musa (NOTE: Due to SF Women's March, this will be from 4-6pm)

- Sat 1/25 @ 1355 Market#900, Host: Tristan

- Sat 2/1 @ USF, Host: Ethan

Things to note:
- You won't be using your personal phone number, the Yang Dialer will automatically dial for you
- If it's your first time, we'll get you trained and up and running!
- If 5+ sign up, we'll order pizza! 
- We'll also have PRIZES for callers who have the most conversations - gift cards/merch! :)

Optional: 
- See the docs below to prep!
- If you can't make it to our parties, it's easy to make calls on your own time:

Training video: https://www.loom.com/share/32a5238ab95d41559632158f514e7774

Preview script: https://desktop.thrutalk.io/candidate/yang-iowa-voter-id


Info: http://yang2020.com/call


Calling Handbook: https://docs.google.com/document/d/17xNaWzkv6ZxpU2dQECmDFc8KcTuNj_ZOAXf9yy8jrJM/edit#


Join the Volunteer Slack: https://yang2020.com/join-volunteer-slack?_ga=2.160313533.1294883436.1577391748-1649086547.1577391748

183824.description:
We will be volunteering for our eighth month with Community Lunch on Capitol Hill. They are a fantastic organization and provide hot, nutritious meals and survival services to those experiencing homelessness and low-income people in Seattle.  Everyone is welcome to this event. This is a great way to serve and connect to our community.  As the days have become darker, it's more important than ever to show people that they all matter.  That we are all human and therefore have value.  Please join us.

You can learn more about this organization here: https://www.communitylunch.org

Our next event will be Wednesday January 22nd from 3-6:30pm.

It will take place at All Pilgrims Christian Church 500 Broadway E Seattle, WA 98102. On corner of Broadway & Republican.

Please spread the word and let me know if you can make it! 

I will let you know details about volunteering when you RSVP.  Let me know if you have any questions.

#HumanityFirst

-- Melissa Garrity 612-293-6723
183824.title: Seattle Yang Gang #PledgeforHumanity  @ Community Lunch on Capitol Hill

So let’s knock on every door and make every phone call we can to show our friends and neighbors how a Humanity First national would benefit them.

Every day our passionate supporters reach out to those in their communities to share Andrew’s plans to create opportunity for every American and ensure our children the future they deserve.

If you’ve never volunteered before, no worries! Our friendly staff will help catch you up to speed. In fact, many of Andrew Yang’s most ardent volunteers are first time Caucus goers. What matters most is that you realize your own power. In every door knock and every phone call, our movement is one step closer to achieving Andrew’s vision: an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality, for every person.

Please join us and be a part of that effort. Nothing short of the future of our nation is at stake.

Note: If you do, thank you! Please bring a fully charged cell phone. We've got everything else you will need, including Andrew Yang merchandise for volunteers that help multiple times!
184482.title: Weekend Phone Bank: Muscatine
184482.summary: Calling all Yang Gang for Call Time

184484.description:
What up, Yang Gang! 
 
Join us to knock on doors for Andrew Yang. Speaking to voters face-to-face is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming caucus. No experience required and introverts welcome! You will be trained. 
 
We will have everything teed up for you and ready to go. With the scripts and drop down menus on your screen, it couldn't be easier. You will need your phone, of course. 
 
Every conversation with a voter gets us that much closer to winning Iowa for Andrew! 

PS Bring a friend!

PPS If you can't canvass, we will do mini phone banks as well.
184484.title: Neighborhood Knocking: Muscatine
184484.summary: Knocking doors till the caucus comes home

185331.description:
Speaking to voters face-to-face in early states is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming election right now. 

If you want to help Andrew Yang win and are available on Saturday, then sign up and canvass in NH with us.

Let's bring our CT Yang Gang energy to our northern Yangsters and help Andrew Yang win the New Hampshire February 11 primary! 

We will meet Saturday 8 am at the selected location.

We'll carpool to New Hampshire, canvass til 5p, and then have a celebratory Yang Hang with volunteers and campaign staff members.

To return, we'll depart New Hampshire around 6:30 or 7 pm.  Return to Wallingford by 9:00 pm.

Not sure which region you belong in? Check out the "Carpool Map for CT" tab on this spreadsheet: http://bit.ly/YGNECarpool
185331.title: Southwestern CT to  Keene NH - Carpool, Canvass, and Yang Hang
185331.summary: Join your fellow Yang Gang members from CT,NH, and other states  to help us win NH

185530.description:
Super fun & engaging volunteer opportunity to spread the message of Yang 20/20!

Volunteer to work our booth at Hmong Village in St. Paul. It is a fantastic shopping mall and produce market with a wonderful food court.  We have a booth that we need to staff from now until the primaries EVERY SATURDAY AND EVERY SUNDAY from 11-5, with FLEXIBLE TWO HOUR SHIFTS. 

Shoppers are very receptive. We sell merchandise as well. It is a great opportunity to share information about Yang2020. We provide the materials! Parking is free! Entrance to the mall is free! 

To find our booth - locate the produce/farmers market area and we are at the back next to a pharmacy and the only bathrooms in that area. 

Please feel free to contact us with any questions. :)
185530.title: Tabling at Hmong Village in St Paul

185537.description:

185708.description:

Speaking to voters face-to-face in early states is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming election right now. Let's bring our CT Yang Gang energy to our northern Yangsters and help Andrew Yang win the New Hampshire February 11 primary!

Bring a friend, download the app "MiniVAN", on your smartphone and meet us for a fun-filled day in the neighborhood. Here’s a guide with more explanation: http://bit.ly/y2020canvass

We will meet Saturdays at 7:30 am at the I-84 Exit 62 commuter lot on Buckland St. in Manchester, CT.

We'll carpool to Nashua and join the 11 am canvass slot. After the canvass we will have a celebratory Yang Hang at The Flight Center Beer Cafe!

Depart New Hampshire around 6:30 or 7 pm, getting back to Manchester CT around 9-10pm

Not sure which region you belong in? Check out the "Carpool Map for CT" tab on this spreadsheet: http://bit.ly/YGNECarpool
185708.title: North Central CT to Nashua NH - Carpool, Canvass, and Yang Hang

186598.accessibility_notes: This is an outdoor activity, and the table is usually near the bus stop at the corner (directly across the street from the Grand Lake Theater). We've seen people with wheel chairs navigate the space fine.
186598.description:
Help us staff the table for a couple of hours or the whole time (9am-2pm). You can even bring unused, unopened toiletry items to donate to a local nonprofit for the benefit of those who struggle to afford basic necessities (#pledgeforhumaity).

We have an Andrew Yang cut-out and a Yang buck for fun photo ops. We play music inspired by the Yang campaign. We have a table full of takeaway buttons, brochures, stickers, and cards. Most of all we have fellow Yang Gang who bring themselves, their passion, and good conversation.

Help us to Yang the crowd that flocks to the most popular farmers market of the Bay Area every Saturday!
186598.title: Oakland, CA - Crowd-Yanging at the Grand Lake Farmers Market

190178.title: Mitigating Climate Change with Atoms
190178.description:
Andrew's policies have something for everyone. And we are a curious group! Local experts on Nuclear energy  want to help share their knowledge and excited that Andrew has included this piece in the climate change discussion.

Come have a discussion about the prospects of atomic energy as a tool to help mitigate climate change. The USA generated 4.2 billion megawatt-hours of clean-air, low-carbon electricity by splitting atoms in 2018, making up 19% of the USA's total electricity. Yet, this energy source is controversial and hotly debated. Its low-carbon nature is inspiring many young scientists and engineers to enter the field, and is causing many environmentalists to reconsider their positions on it in the face of the potential consequences of climate change.

We will be featuring a local advanced reactor designer and founder of whatisnuclear.com (Nick Touran, Ph.D. in Nuclear Engineering from the University of Michigan) and an ecopragmatist from the Seattle Ecomodernist Society (Karl Pauls). They will present that history, current status, and future prospects of nuclear technology, including details about Thorium fuel as discussed in the Democratic debates by Andrew Yang. The highlight will be the Q&A discussion session afterwards, so come with questions!

194881.description:
### [Call for Yang TODAY!](https://www.yang2020.com/call/)

Hey Yang Gang! Calling early state voters is one of the most impactful thing we can be doing right now to help Andrew get elected. We truly can't thank you all enough for your support and commitment to this movement.

Follow the steps below to get started:

1. Join our Yang 2020 Slack where you can chat with other callers and ask questions by [opening this link in a separate tab](https://www.yang2020.com/join-volunteer-slack/). 

2. Everything you need to know about making calls can be found in our Call Team Handbook which you can check out by [opening this link in a separate tab](https://docs.google.com/document/d/17xNaWzkv6ZxpU2dQECmDFc8KcTuNj_ZOAXf9yy8jrJM/edit?usp=sharing)

3. Sign up for as many shifts as you'd like by filling in your info on the right side of your screen! If something changes with your schedule, don't worry about cancelling. The dialer is usually open from 11:00AM CT to 8:00PM CT. Occasionally, it is open for longer, give or take an hour or two. We're *strongly* encouraging everyone to sign up at "peak hours" 3:00PM CT - 7:00PM CT in order to minimize the wait time between calls.

4. Once in the Yang 2020 Slack, go to the #callers_start_here channel where Calling Support will be able to answer any questions you have!

Face-to-face conversations are an effective way to build awareness and support for Andrew Yang’s campaign. Every door-to-door canvassing event is an opportunity for your volunteering time to have a significant, positive impact for the campaign.

(2) a clipboard with a few sheets of blank paper, if you have one

(4) a MATH hat if you have one

197354.description:
The Yang Gang needs YOU! We need to spread Andrew Yang's UNIQUE message of policies driven by Humanity and backed by Data to as many South Carolina voters as possible! The scripts are easy and great guides and any questions can be followed up by staff.

198583.description:
TangoTab launched the first Feed The City, a community engagement event, in January 2015. Volunteers of all ages, races and religious beliefs work together to make meals for people less fortunate, in their communities.

In Houston it takes place every second Saturday at Clutch Bar on Washington Ave. Arrive between 8:30am and 9:00am with sandwich supplies (list will be emailed to you on sign up). Sandwich making starts at 9am and lasts until approximately 10:30am.

Come socialize with fellow Yang Gang and show others what it means to be #HumanityFirst!

198612.description:
Thanks for signing up to attend this Yang Gang Hang! Getting together with other supporters in our local area to talk about text banking and canvassing is how we help Andrew win. Below is what we plan on covering at the meeting:

2.	How can we get more involved in canvassing, texting, and signature gathering.

Meet at Denny's Place.
198612.title: Crescent, IA - Yang Gang Hang

199208.description:
Join Andrew for his Town Hall in Dubuque at Driftless! 

Doors open at 10:30. RSVP is not required but encouraged.

---------------
Come meet Andrew Yang! An Entrepreneur. A husband and father. And a non-profit leader.

Andrew Yang will be hosting multiple town halls and events to engage with Iowans and share his bold plans to rewrite the rules of the 21st-century economy so they work fairly for everyone, not just corporations.

Andrew's not a career politician. He's a job creator who understands the economy. That is why as president, Andrew's first priority will be to implement the big solutions America needs to get back on track. To start, he'd enact a $1,000 a month Freedom Dividend, no strings attached, for every American 18 and older. Andrew understands that if the rules of our economy don't work for everyone, they don't work. As the father of two young boys, Andrew is committed to doing everything in his power to create the kind of future our children deserve—one with an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality.
199208.title: Dubuque Town Hall with Andrew Yang

199545.description:
Thanks for signing up to attend the Humboldt County Yang Gang Hang!

This will be a casual meetup at the Ramones in Wildberries (the sun room) on every Saturday @ 6:30pm to discuss how to get involved with the campaign and plan for the coming weeks. Specifically will be discussing getting things together for phonebanking parties, fundraisers, and the usual tabling and yanging at local events! The cafe isn't the biggest so will be easy to spot. Look for the redhead with the Yanged out laptop!

Connecting through our Facebook group "Humboldt County Yang Gang" is great, but getting supporters together in-real-life (IRL) is how we can really grow and help Andrew win! The purpose of this meeting is just to get to know other Yang supporters in our community, talk about what drew us to the campaign, and discuss ways to get Andrew to the White House - making calls, sending texts, knocking on doors, but also fun actions at local community events!

This is to be a fairly informal meeting. Don’t feel obligated to prepare anything before hand or feel like you need to have prior campaigning experience to show up. We just want to start building a Yang Gang presence in our community as we approach the Democratic Primary beginning with that early voting in February.

This will hopefully be a great place to prepare for canvassing and brainstorm creative ways to make everyone aware of Yang's message. Bring your ideas, and I will bring Yang Cards to share!

And really this location is just to start, but we can change it if someone thinks up or can offer a more suitable place -and the time as well if another works better for everybody. Can't wait to see everyone there!
199545.title: Arcata, CA - Yang Gang Hang

199568.description:
Weekly tabling every Sat. 10am - 2pm at the Arcata Farmer's Market! As name recognition continues to go up and up for Yang, the need also increases to go beyond that and help people connect that name to the policies and Humanity First philosophy that are our reasons for supporting him in the first place!

Help connect interested community members with other Yang supporters, show how they can help too, share with the Yang-curious why you support Yang over the crowd of other candidates, and help spread that correct information over mis-information (make America think harder)!

This is our opportunity to have face-to-face conversations with the community-at-large, grow our grassroots base, and make lasting impressions that are far more impactful and lasting than the mere sharing of talking points!

Email to designate a specific time slot, or just come on down and give moral support on your break -the more the merrier!

Chairs, table, and logistics are all taken care of, but what we are always in need of are more materials (Prints: infographics, cards, posters), let us know what you can contribute by email or call, or/and drop off your favorite material from yangprints.com or elsewhere. And, if you simply want to help but don't know specifically how, simply contact us and we'll move you forward!

Can't wait to see you there, -Humanity First!
199568.title: Arcata CA - Tabling @ Arcata's Farmer's Market

242-02 61st Ave
Douglaston, NY 11362

Sunday, January 26, 2020 from 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM

201161.description:
Hi Yang Gang! It's time for a road trip! Come meet up with members of the Wisconsin Yang Gangs to canvass in Dubuque, IA.  We will be carpooling from Milwaukee if you live there or if you are in Madison, we could pick you up on the way! 

Join us to knock on doors for Andrew Yang. Speaking to voters face-to-face is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming caucus. No experience required and introverts welcome!

We will have everything teed up for you and ready to go. With the scripts and drop down menus on your screen, it couldn't be easier. You will need your phone, of course.

Every conversation with a voter gets us that much closer to winning Iowa for Andrew!

PS Bring a friend, and or bring the family!
201161.title: Wisconsin Yang Gang Canvass  trip to Dubuque, IA

201415.description:
Face-to-face conversations continue to be one of the most meaningful ways to communicate with potential voters, and door-to-door canvassing is a highly effective way to initiate these interactions. Let’s meet at 11AM on Sunday at Elwood Bluffs Trailhead in Goleta to talk about our script, and then let’s knock on some doors!

Disclosure:  Canvassing sounds scary, but it really isn't.  A few of us have been doing it for the past few weekends, and we're getting the hang of it, even introverted me.  If you are new to canvassing, you'll pair with someone who has done it before. 

We'll plan to canvass for a few hours, and then break for a group lunch at 1pm.
201415.title: Goleta, CA Yang Canvass

201428.description:
Hey Yang Gang!!

Do you want to secure the bag? If you answered yes, then YOU need to be a Precinct Captain!!! Being a Precinct Captain is the BEST way to help the campaign. You will be absolutely pivotal in winning us the caucuses. WE cannot shock the world without your help.  

Join  our Precinct Captain Class and learn exactly what precinct captains do. You also get a special Precinct Captain hat that has the Iowa Flag under the bill if you become a captain.

What you need to be a precinct captain? 
1. Humanity first -- always
2. A smart phone. 
3. Show up to a Precinct Captain class.  DONE.

See you there, Yang Gang!
201428.title: Orange City, IA - Precinct Captain Class: Securing the bag together

201434.description:
Saturday, January 25th at 10AM to 1PM

Join us Saturday at the Bixby Park Farmers Market in Long Beach, CA! Enjoy fresh agua frescas, pupusas, amazing donuts, live music and more while tabling at the park just blocks away from the ocean.

Bixby Park is a beautiful park located in the heart of Long Beach. The area is incredibly diverse and every weekend there are hundreds of people at this park doing yoga, shopping at the farmers market, skating at the skate park and picnicking at the park. It's gonna be a blast and we'd love to have you!

201928.description:
Please  join us in celebration of the 2020 Chinese New Year and learning about Yang2020! 
It is the Year of Mouse and prosperity! 
Worth County Chinese New Year’s Party
Worth County Democratic Headquarters
812 Central Ave, Northwood, IA 50459
January 25, 2020, 1:00 PM ~ 4:00 PM
The door opens at 1:00 PM. There will be Chinese Calligraphy stations set up for you to watch, learn, practice and create your own authentic piece of “福” (good fortune) to take home. 202015.description:
Speaking to voters face-to-face in early states is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming election right now. Let's bring our MA Yang Gang energy to our northern Yangsters and help Andrew Yang win the New Hampshire February 11 primary!

You MUST complete this Google Survey as part of this sign-up in order to be matched with other supporters and matching shift preferences: https://bit.ly/2q421Sw (Note: Mobilize shows you the start and end times of the first and last available shift)

The Massachusetts Yang Gang Operations Team will help to match drivers to riders toward our sister city, Manchester, NH. Canvassing is more fun with friends after all!

We'll carpool to New Hampshire leaving at 9 am, canvass until 4 pm, and then have a celebratory Yang Hang with volunteers from around the region, local Yang Gang and campaign staff members. To return, we'll depart New Hampshire around 7-8 pm. Return to MA by 8:00-9:00 pm.

Bring a friend, download the app "MiniVAN", on your smartphone and meet us for a fun-filled day in the neighborhood. Here’s a guide with more explanation: http://bit.ly/y2020canvass (edited)

Not sure which region you belong in? Check out the "Carpool Map for MA" tab on this spreadsheet: http://bit.ly/YGNECarpool
202015.title: Western MA to Manchester NH - Carpool, Canvass, and Yang Hang

202564.description:
Come join local members of the Yang Gang and campaign volunteers for an evening of tubing fun at Cone Park. Cost $7 for a 3-hour session (with unlimited rides); come an hour earlier (6 PM CST when the park opens) to get your money’s worth and meet up when more Yang Gang members arrive at 7 PM CST. Snow tubes are provided (no outside tubes are allowed). Minimum age is 5 (all ages can use the Blue Bunny Hill). The park closes for rain, severe snowstorms (where travel isn’t recommended), and for temperatures at or below 0 degrees. Be aware that sessions can sell out (buy tickets online: https://www.coneparksiouxcity.com/). Cone Park FAQs: https://www.coneparksiouxcity.com/faq/
In southeast Sioux City, the park is situated near I-29 and the Highway 20 bypass to the east of the ibp Ice Center and Lewis & Clark Ballpark.
202564.title: SIOUX CITY, IOWA - Yang Gang Hang

202679.description:
Door to Door Canvassing (includes training for first-timers)

Face-to-face conversations are an effective way to build awareness and support for Andrew Yang’s campaign. Every door-to-door canvassing event is an opportunity for your volunteering time to have a significant, positive impact for the campaign.

Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the official starting time so you will be ready to receive training, guidelines, and materials before we begin walking the neighborhood.

Dress business casual and/or wear your Yang clothes, especially your MATH hat. 

Bring: 
(1) a water bottle and snacks you can carry in your pocket 
(2) a clipboard with a few sheets of blank paper, if you have one 
(3) a mobile "smart" device such as a smartphone or a tablet to run the canvassing app 
(4) a MATH hat if you have one

202687.description:
Join Andrew for his Town Hall in Winneshiek County! 

Our Town Hall is at Impact Coffee in Decorah. 

Doors open at 3:00pm. RSVP is not required but encouraged.

Come meet Andrew Yang! An Entrepreneur. A husband and father. And a non-profit leader.

Andrew Yang will be hosting multiple town halls and events to engage with Iowans and share his bold plans to rewrite the rules of the 21st-century economy so they work fairly for everyone, not just corporations.

Andrew's not a career politician. He's a job creator who understands the economy. That is why as president, Andrew's first priority will be to implement the big solutions America needs to get back on track. To start, he'd enact a $1,000 a month Freedom Dividend, no strings attached, for every American 18 and older. Andrew understands that if the rules of our economy don't work for everyone, they don't work. As the father of two young boys, Andrew is committed to doing everything in his power to create the kind of future our children deserve—one with an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality.
202687.title: Andrew Yang Town Hall in Winneshiek County

203204.description:
YANG WON’T WIN IF HE’S NOT ON THE BALLOT! 

Come sign the petition to get Andrew Yang on the ballot.

Learn how you can get involved in the campaign.

Meet some of the local delegates that are running.

Drink a tasty bubble tea.

To sign/witness the petition, you must be registered to vote in New York as a DEMOCRAT. (Look yourself up at https://voterlookup.elections.ny.gov/) in NY state.

To update your registration before the event: Go in person to submit the voter form at: Broome County Board of Elections, 60 Hawley St, 2nd Floor, Binghamton, NY 13901 Open M-F 8:30-4:30 Phone: 607-778-2172

Updating your registration online or by mail will take one week.

Not registered in NY as a Dem?  You can help funnel people to petition holders to sign and/or volunteer.

Please find and review the collection guide: https://sites.google.com/yang2020.com/nypetition

Please contact the host if you have questions.

Let's exercise our rights and move the country forward. Get Andrew Yang and his delegates on the ballot!

Thank you, from the Binghamton Yang Gang. https://www.facebook.com/events/2905928352773341/
203204.title: Signature Collecting at Old Tea House,  Vestal, New York, NY-22
203204.summary: Let's enjoy bubble tea and get Andrew Yang on the NY Primary Ballot!

203288.description:
HIGH PRIORITY: New Hampshire primary is February 11th! These calls will be focused on identifying voters.

Please Note: We are using votebuilder and manually dialing phone numbers (NOT the dialer).

3 Easy Steps:

1) RSVP to see training video link. 
2) Send me your slack username to be added to a private NH callers channel *OR* I can email you a call list link. 
3) Create an Action ID or log in to start making calls.

Weekdays: 3 PM - 8PM EST
Weekends: 10 AM - 8 PM EST

On Saturdays  we hold a zoom call for 30 minutes at 2:30 PM EST with all attendees, link: https://zoom.us/j/860503073

On weekdays, I am available for 1:1 Q&A support.
203288.title: Phone Bank for New Hampshire

Andrew Yang will be hosting multiple town halls and events to engage with Iowans and share his bold plans to rewrite the rules of the 21st-century economy so they work fairly for everyone, not just corporations.

Andrew's not a career politician. He's a job creator who understands the economy. That is why as president, Andrew's first priority will be to implement the big solutions America needs to get back on track. To start, he'd enact a $1,000 a month Freedom Dividend, no strings attached, for every American 18 and older. Andrew understands that if the rules of our economy don't work for everyone, they don't work. As the father of two young boys, Andrew is committed to doing everything in his power to create the kind of future our children deserve—one with an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality.

204432.description:
**The nomination papers will be fresh off the presses & this will be our first signature collection opportunity in Rhode Island!**

The Rhode Island process is very fast. From the time we pick up the nomination papers (Thu 1/23) to when the whole process of gathering, notarizing, and submitting 1k+ signatures must be finished (Thu 2/6 by 4pm), we have just two weeks to put Andrew Yang on the RI ballot.

Very do-able, but we just have to be organized. (Every candidate is going thru this same process.)

**Before coming to the event:**

- please review our signature gathering guide: http://bit.ly/RISigGuide
- please listen to this 11 min clip: https://youtu.be/hGyB5eJEGJI 

We'll be meeting at the Starbucks in One Financial, doing a quick training, and then walking over to Kennedy Plaza transit center to gather signatures from registered voters waiting for their buses home (and possibly a group will head over to the Providence Place mall too).

PLEASE BRING A CLIPBOARD! 

**Afterward**, we're going to walk over to **Sakis Pizzeria (199 Weybosset St)** for a post-collection Yang Gang Hang. Something to eat & an opportunity to plan where everyone is going to gather signatures over the weekend!

Let’s get Andrew Yang on the ballot!
204432.title: Rhode Island Signature Gathering - 1st opportunity to sign & to get signatures for Andrew Yang!
204432.summary: It’s time, Rhode Island! Let’s get Andrew Yang on the ballot!

204503.description:
With only a handful of weeks remaining before the Caucus, join the Yang Gang as we continue to build our wave of momentum before it crashes down on Feb. 3 the business as usual system stacked against working class Iowans.

We have the grassroots energy to win this election, but we can’t let up if we want to rewrite the rules of the 21st century and put Andrew Yang in the White House. So let’s knock on every door and make every phone call we can to show our friends and neighbors how a Humanity First national would benefit them.

Every day our passionate supporters reach out to those in their communities to share Andrew’s plans to create opportunity for every American and ensure our children the future they deserve.  

If you’ve never volunteered before, no worries! Our friendly staff will help catch you up to speed. In fact, many of Andrew Yang’s most ardent volunteers are first time Caucus goers. What matters most is that you realize your own power. In every door knock and every phone call, our movement is one step closer to achieving Andrew’s vision: an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality, for every person. 

Please join us and be a part of that effort. Nothing short of the future of our nation is at stake.

Note: If you do, thank you! Please bring a fully charged cell phone. We've got everything else you will need, including Andrew Yang merchandise for volunteers that help multiple times!
204503.title: Weekend Phone Bank: Mason City
204503.summary: Calling all Yang Gang for Call Time

205262.description:
Agenda

1) Differences between canvassing/tabling and signature-gathering. 2) A time-proved script to maximize your signature volume while minimizing unproductive exchanges. 3) Individual one-on-one practice in delivering the script. 4) Common objections and how to overcome them. 5) Measuring your metric. 6) Practical tips on working the street and public/private spaces.

This is a must-attend webinar for anyone who wants to collect signatures in volume. This webinar focuses on the psychological dynamics of asking a stranger for a signature. It does not include the technical details of the applicable state regulations, as these are covered in other training sessions. This session also includes one-on-one role-playing using the script.

After attending this session, you will know how to frame your ask in a way that is actually enjoyable for you and your prospect. You will understand the common objections and how to overcome them.
205262.title: New York, NY - High Volume Signature Gathering Training Webinar

Let's get to know each other while enjoying a drink in a cool local bar. We'll talk about why we support Yang, then we'll be signing petitions to get him on the NY ballot, and learning how to get more involved.

Yang Gang from any district are welcome, but I would like to especially encourage those in District 8 to come out! Find out your district here: https://ziplook.house.gov/htbin/findrep_house?ZIP=

If you can't be there at 7:30 (this may be early for some people), no worries, you can come by whenever you want!

Accessible via the B46, B46 SBS, B26, A/C trains

205746.description:
FB event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/210029813357641/

Join the delegates for three progressive candidates of the Democratic primary in an evening of conversation and signature gathering, and become engaged in this most critical election of our life time. 

Is the national news on Democratic primary driving you crazy? Are you sick of the discord among progressives portrayed by the national media? Don’t let them fool you. In our community, our local delegates are working side by side helping people make informed decisions while nurturing communication and cooperation among each other that will unite us in our common goal: the wellbeing of individuals, the community, the society, and the planet.

NY19 delegates Rebecca Rojer (Bernie Sanders), Daniel Torres (Elizabeth Warren), Keiko Sono and Roger Green (Andrew Yang) will share their inside stories and discuss how their candidates’ policies will impact our communities, followed by Q&A. During the event, registered Democrats will be able to sign the petition to put their candidates and delegates on the ballot of the New York State primary on April 28 (one petition per voter).

For more information on gathering signatures in NY,  please review: http://bit.ly/38OC8Ie
205746.title: Kingston, NY - Sanders, Warren, Yang Delegates Panel, Q&A and Signature Gathering

Do you want to secure the bag? If you answered yes, then YOU need to be a Precinct Captain!!! Being a Precinct Captain is the BEST way to help the campaign. You will be absolutely pivotal in winning us the caucuses. WE cannot shock the world without your help.

Join our Precinct Captain Class and learn exactly what precinct captains do. You also get a special Precinct Captain hat that has the Iowa Flag under the bill if you become a captain.

What you need to be a precinct captain? 1. Humanity first -- always 2. A smart phone. 3. Show up to a Precinct Captain class. DONE.

See you there, Yang Gang!

P.S. If you can’t make it to this one, there will be more Precinct Captain classes soon!

206469.description:
Speaking to voters face-to-face in early states is BY FAR the biggest impact you can have on the upcoming election right now. Let's bring our VT Yang Gang energy to our neighbors and help Andrew Yang win the New Hampshire February 11 primary!

If you want to help Andrew Yang win and are available on Saturday, then sign up and canvass in NH with us.

The Vermont Yang Gang Operations Team will help to match drivers to riders toward our sister city, Keene, NH. Canvassing is more fun with friends after all!

We'll carpool to New Hampshire leaving at 9:30-10:30 am and canvass until 5 pm. We'll do a Yang Gang Hang, a celebratory dinner, from 5:30-7:30 pm in Keene. To return, We'll depart New Hampshire around 7:30 pm, returning to VT by 8:30-9:30 pm.

Bring a friend, download the app "MiniVAN", on your smartphone and meet us for a fun-filled day in the neighborhood. Here’s a guide with more explanation: http://bit.ly/y2020canvass
206469.title: Southern Vermont to Keene NH - Carpool & Canvass

206622.description:
Join Andrew for his Town Hall in Oskaloosa at the Penn Central Mall (Atrium)!

Doors open at 8:30am. RSVP is not required but encouraged.

Come meet Andrew Yang! An Entrepreneur. A husband and father. And a non-profit leader.

Andrew Yang will be hosting multiple town halls and events to engage with Iowans and share his bold plans to rewrite the rules of the 21st-century economy so they work fairly for everyone, not just corporations.

Andrew's not a career politician. He's a job creator who understands the economy. That is why as president, Andrew's first priority will be to implement the big solutions America needs to get back on track. To start, he'd enact a $1,000 a month Freedom Dividend, no strings attached, for every American 18 and older. Andrew understands that if the rules of our economy don't work for everyone, they don't work. As the father of two young boys, Andrew is committed to doing everything in his power to create the kind of future our children deserve—one with an America of opportunity, freedom, and equality.
206622.title: Andrew Yang Oskaloosa Town Hall

206745.description:
It's crunch time, and we need all hands on deck. Here's the time line:

Feb 3: Voter Registration Deadline 
Feb 12-25: Early Voting Begins 
March 3: Primary Voting (TN is a Super Tuesday state!)

What can we do? The campaign's #1 priority in Tennessee right now is targeted door-to-door canvassing. Real life conversations continue to be one of the most meaningful ways to engage with potential voters. You don't need experience and you don't need to be a policy expert. Just bring your enthusiasm, manners, a mobile device and any literature you would like to distribute.

Let’s meet at Starbucks for a brief training, and fuel up to introduce our neighbors to Andrew Yang!

Volunteers are welcome to join or bow out as needed throughout the day. Keep an eye out for more events as we plan to canvass steadily over the next several weeks. If the schedule doesn't work for you, register anyway so that an organizer can set you up to canvass your area independently or help you team up with another volunteer.

Let's DO this!

Whether it’s your first time or you’re a pro – it’s more fun phonebanking together. Plus, we’ll have pizza and drinks of the non-boozy kind. And awesome prizes throughout the day.

207341.description:
As we all know the Iowa caucus (Feb. 3rd) is almost upon us! We currently have boots on the ground canvassing in Iowa but they need our help collecting more voter data to know which houses to target.  That's why **phone banking for Iowa is the most impactful thing you can do to help Yang right now**.  Don't worry if you've never phone banked before.  It's a lot easier than you think.  The campaign is more interested in the data collection aspect rather than trying to "convert" a random person on the phone (of course that's nice too).  Get started ahead of time by reading the materials at https://www.yang2020.com/call/.

***Remember to bring a laptop, cell phone, and chargers*** If you have an extra laptop please bring that as well!  

Where: 155 Bovet Rd, San Mateo, CA 94402

When: Saturday 1/25/20  at 11am - 4pm 

Please feel free to bring some food and drinks to share with everyone.

Humanity First!

-SVYG and SMYG

Join our Precinct Captain Class and learn exactly what precinct captains do. You also get a special Precinct Captain hat that has the Iowa Flag under the bill if you become a captain.

What you need to be a precinct captain? 1. Humanity first -- always 2. A smart phone. 3. Show up to a Precinct Captain class. DONE.

See you there, Yang Gang!

P.S. If you can’t make it to this one, there will be more Precinct Captain classes soon!

207914.description:
Join us for a day trip to Reno to knock on doors for Andrew Yang!

We all know how influential the early voting states are, but not all of us can make it out to Iowa. Luckily, we live pretty close to another early voting state: Nevada. 

Data shows canvassing is *the most effective* grassroots tool out there. If you've never canvassed before, don't worry! We will train you and provide all necessary materials It's easy and fun. So let's get out there and make a difference! 

We'll plan to leave Sacramento around 8:45/9:00 AM and head home from Reno around 4:00 PM. 

Sacramento Yang Gang will be helping to arrange carpools, and more information on that will be provided once we get a better sense of our headcount. 

*if the weather is too bad to safely make the drive, we’ll create a local canvassing event & reschedule Reno for another weekend*

It is a TOP CAMPAIGN PRIORITY to call voters in the Early States (Iowa + New Hampshire)!  We have less than 2 weeks until the Iowa Caucus on Feb. 3rd and 3 weeks until the New Hampshire Caucus on Feb. 11th.  It's critical that we put in the time to call NOW!

Please come help out for any amount of time you can.  
Drop in at any time between 1-5pm, whether it's 30 min, an hour, two hours, however much time you can dedicate to get Yang elected!

Just bring your own laptop, earbuds/headphones, and a positive attitude :)

Things to note: - You won't be using your personal phone number, the Yang Dialer will automatically dial for you - It's data gathering with a script of few simple questions and it's not necessary to give a persuasive pitch for Yang unless the conversation naturally flows towards that.  

Optional: - See the docs below to prep! - If you can't make it to our parties, it's easy to make calls on your own time:

Training video: https://www.loom.com/share/32a5238ab95d41559632158f514e7774

208604.description:
Door to Door Canvassing (includes training for first-timers)

Face-to-face conversations are an effective way to build awareness and support for Andrew Yang’s campaign. Every door-to-door canvassing event is an opportunity for your volunteering time to have a significant, positive impact for the campaign.

Please arrive at least 10 minutes before the official starting time so you will be ready to receive training, guidelines, and materials before we begin walking the neighborhood.

Dress business casual and/or wear your Yang clothes, especially your MATH hat. 

Bring: 
(1) a water bottle and snacks you can carry in your pocket 
(2) a clipboard with a few sheets of blank paper, if you have one

Bring your computers and chargers!

In order to get Andrew Yang on the primary ballot in New York we need to collect 15000 signatures on the presidential petition and 1000 signatures on the delegate petition.  The New York City Yang Gang will be hosting a signature gathering event outside the 61st Street Subway Station on Sunday, January 26th from 2:00pm to 5:00pm.

We need your help! If you would like to help collect signatures that is FANTASTIC. If you don’t feel comfortable collecting but would like to sign your name, that is AMAZING too!

If you are coming to collect signatures be sure to wear comfortable shoes, bring water and snacks. If you have a clipboard and pen, that is a bonus too!

209135.description:
We will be hosting a Phone-Banking event at the student union on Friday, Jan 24th. I don't have a room rented out, but we will find spaces based on the amount of that show up! Calling Iowa is our #1 priority right now, since many people are on the fence about him. If we show out good there, we have a greater chance of Yanging locals in California. I'll be in the middle of the Conrad Prebys Student Union with a MATH hat on.

It'll probably go from 1-4. If you have never phone banked before, DON'T WORRY! We're here to help. The more people, the more comfortable we'll be. It's stressful, but in the end, it'll be worth it. We're the grassroots movement that gets our guy in the White House
